intro: Blastus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered blastus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Blastus parviflorus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
